action.action-desc: Mr. Duncan of Tennessee introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Crop Insurance Act to prohibit payments of premium subsidy for harvest price policies.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Harvest Price Subsidy Prohibition Act.

section.header: Prohibition on premium subsidy for harvest price policies
section.text: Section 508(e) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1508(e)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Prohibition on premium subsidy for harvest price policies
paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law and beginning with the 2018 reinsurance year, the Corporation may not pay any amount of premium subsidy in the case of a policy or plan of insurance that is based on the actual market price of an agricultural commodity at the time of harvest.
